channel.title: How the new RuneScape update will affect our server hosting
channel.description:
As many of you know our private servers that we host are popular because we believe in not having trading limits integrated and cause we allow players to pk (player kill) like the old RuneScape days. This may be all good for the current RuneScape players but what will happen to our privately owned servers. The main draw is because of the freedom you are given in our games when you compare them to the real RuneScape. Is this a multi stage plan by jagex to drop the number of private servers, gain a massive profit and to regain their lost customers? You decide.
Luv/Hate

item.title: How the new RuneScape update will affect our server hosting
item.dc:creator: @R_A_R_E_S R A R E S
item.description:
@R_A_R_E_S wrote:

Well that is not the only reason people play RSPS, they play because the staff give a shit (sometimes) and that it is easier to obtain items and do not have to no life on the game to get good things. People play RSPS to have fun more than anything so as numbers MAY drop i do not think a lot of players would quit because of the update. (my opinion)

item.title: How the new RuneScape update will affect our server hosting
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“DemisePking, post:7, topic:374348”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=470329.msg3438886#msg3438886 date=1292966035]

Most of the big servers are mainly lucky leechers. I have played many top servers now and they are almost all PI based with same home etc.
[/quote]PI scape was released without a license. No one can steal that source.

PI scape? Seriously?[/quote]Lol’d

It will help. All of the faggots buying dedicated servers and raking in cash will be obsessed with the new update and those like me who already realize RuneScape is broken will be taking over the RSPS business with old servers. >=D

Read full topic
